thread.title: Billy Eppler welcomes high expectations as Angels’ new GM
thread.title_full: Billy Eppler welcomes high expectations as Angels’ new GM

author: wtopstaff
title: Billy Eppler welcomes high expectations as Angels’ new GM
text:
Home » News » Sports » MLB » Billy Eppler welcomes high… Billy Eppler welcomes high expectations as Angels’ new GM By GREG BEACHAM October 5, 2015 5:58 pm Longtime Yankees executive Billy Eppler, right, is greeted by Los Angeles Angels manager Mike Scioscia during a news conference announcing Eppler as the new general manager for the Angels in Anaheim, Calif. on Monday, Oct. 5, 2015. The 40-year-old Eppler replaces interim GM Bill Stoneman, who took over after Jerry Dipoto quit his job at midseason following his latest disagreement with Scioscia, the longest-serving manager in baseball. (AP Photo/Nick Ut) 
ANAHEIM, Calif. (AP) — Billy Eppler is unafraid to take on an apparently perilous job as the Los Angeles Angels’ general manager alongside demanding owner Arte Moreno and powerful manager Mike Scioscia. 
Eppler says that’s because he knows all about sky-high expectations in demanding organizations after 11 years with the New York Yankees. 
The Angels introduced Eppler as their 12th general manager on Monday, a day after their season ended. The big-budget club missed the postseason for the fifth time in six years. 
Eppler was the other finalist for this job four years ago, when Moreno hired Jerry Dipoto instead. Dipoto abruptly quit on the Angels at midseason after repeatedly jousting with Scioscia. 
Scioscia confirmed he’ll return for his 17th season next year, and Eppler says he’s eager to work together. Topics:
